rot¶

fisspy.image.base.rot(img, angle, xc=False, yc=False, dx=0, dy=0, xmargin=0, ymargin=0, missing=0)[source]¶

Rotate the input image.

Parameters:
  • img (ndarray) – 2 dimensional array of image.
  • angle (float) – Roation angle in ‘radian’ unit.
  • xc ((optional) float) – x-axis value of roatation center. Default is the image center.
  • yc ((optional) float) – y-axis value of rotation center. Default is the image center.
  • dx ((optional) float) – The relative displacement along x-axis of the rotated images to the reference image.
  • dy ((optional) float) – The relative displacement along y-axis of the rotated images to the reference image.
  • xmargin ((optional) float) – The margin value of x-axis
  • ymargin ((optional) float) – The margin value of y-axis
  • missing ((optional) float) – The value of extrapolated position. Default is -1, and it means the False. If False, then extrapolate the given position.
Returns:

result – rotated image.
Return type:

ndarray

Notes

The input angle must be in radian unit.
